greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{k>=1} (1 + x^k)^(q(k)-1), where q(k) = number of partitions of k into distinct parts (A000009).
comment: Convolution of the sequences A050342 and A081362.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
mathematica: nmax = 45; CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1 + x^k)^(PartitionsQ[k] - 1), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x]
nmax = 45; CoefficientList[Series[Exp[Sum[(-1)^(k + 1)/k (1/ QPochhammer[x^k, x^(2 k)] - 1/(1 - x^k)), {k, 1, nmax}]], {x, 0, nmax}], x]
a[n_] := a[n] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[Sum[(-1)^(k/d + 1) d (PartitionsQ[d] - 1), {d, Divisors[k]}] a[n - k], {k, 1, n}]/n]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 45}]
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jun 07 2018
